intro: Androsace cylindrica var. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy cushion sandwort, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to alpine and subalpine environments.
